business.headline: Markets jump as GST 2.0 lifts consumer-driven stocks. What should investors do?By scrapping the earlier 12% and 28% rates, GST 2.0 promises to simplify compliance and make essentials cheaper. Market participants believe this could set the stage for a consumption revival, with direct benefits for autos, fast-moving consumer goods, cement, housing and financials.

Sensex jumps over 600 points: Why is the stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex gained nearly 600 points in early trade, while the NSE Nifty50 touched 25,900, as investors cheered what is being called GST 2.0.
Sensex jumps 652 points, Nifty above 24,800; Mahindra rises 7%The S&P BSE Sensex rallied 527.86 points to 81,095.39, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 135.65 points to 24,850.70 as of 9:20 am.

Middle class emerges the king as GST 2.0 makes household items cheaperThe GST bonanza will leave more money in the hands of the middle class, which received a substantial tax relief earlier this year after annual income of up to Rs 12 lakh was made tax-free.

Lockheed Martin secures largest-ever Patriot missile order from US ArmyThe Patriot system has long been a cornerstone of US and allied defence strategy. In recent years, its profile has grown after being supplied to Ukraine to counter Russia.

5% GST too low: Montek Singh Ahluwalia bats for single 14% slabEx-Planning Commission deputy chairman Montek Singh Ahluwalia said the GST has too many slabs and cess distortions. He called the 5 per cent slab unsustainable, urging a single 14 per cent rate split between Centre, states and urban local bodies as a "true reform".

GST rates slashed: Big relief for common man; cars, TVs, food items cheaperUnion Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced a major GST overhaul following a council meeting, terming it a structural reform for "ease of living".

5% and 18% GST slabs retained, 40% slab for sin goodsGST tax rates on common use items ranging from hair oil to corn flakes, TVs, and personal health and life insurance policies were slashed after the all-powerful GST Council on Wednesday approved a complete overhaul of the tangled Goods and Services Tax regime.

Can GST reforms be a game changer? Montek Singh Ahluwalia respondsIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, former Planning Commission Deputy Chairperson Dr Montek Singh Ahluwalia talked about upcoming GST reforms and pitched for a 14% single rate formula.

GST 2.0 approved: What gets cheaper and costlier from September 22?The 56th meeting of the GST Council approved the abolition of the 12% and 28% slabs, streamlining the regime into just two standard rates – 5% and 18%. A new 40% slab has also been introduced for sin and luxury goods. The reforms will take effect from September 22, the first day of Navratri.

GST 2.0: Check the complete list of goods under 40% sin taxThe new system, called GST 2.0, introduces a simpler two-slab structure and makes several changes to the way goods are taxed. These changes will take effect from 22 September 2025.

No GST on life and health insurance premiums from September 22After the 56th GST Council meeting, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that insurance services, which currently attract 18% GST, will now be fully exempt.

entertainment.headline: Lokah box office Day 7: Kalyani's film hits Rs 100 crore, continues unstoppable runMalayalam cinema's first female superhero film, 'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra', became the third film in the industry to cross Rs 100 crore at the box office. With overwhelming reviews, the film is continuing its unstoppable run.

Priyanka's hilarious reaction to Nick's loud singing leaves fans gushing. WatchPriyanka Chopra's self-care session got interrupted by husband Nick Jonas. The actor's reaction to her husband singing is simply priceless.

Taylor Swift-Travis Kelce wedding plans: Why singer is in a hurry to get marriedGlobal pop star Taylor Swift and NFL player Travis Kelce's potential wedding venue has been disclosed just days after the couple confirmed their engagement.

Bastian is going nowhere: Shilpa Shetty clarifies, announces new plansActor Shilpa Shetty clarified that her popular Bandra restaurant, Bastian, is not closing. She also announced the launch of a new restaurant, Ammakai.

Wuthering Heights teaser: Margot Robbie, Jacob Elordi heat up Bronte adaptationEmerald Fennell's new 'Wuthering Heights' teaser promises a provocative and erotically charged adaptation. The casting and content have sparked mixed reactions ahead of its Valentine's Day release.

The Voice of Hind Rajab, drama on Gaza girl, gets 23-min ovation at Venice Fest'The Voice of Hind Rajab' docu-drama premiered at the Venice Film Festival to a 23-minute standing ovation. The film sheds light on the tragic death of a six-year-old Gaza girl amid Israeli military fire, sparking calls for justice and awareness.

Director Raj Nidimoru's ex-wife shares new cryptic post after Samantha's viral reelActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu's recent Dubai reel once again stirred rumours about her relationship with director Raj Nidimoru. His ex-wife Shhyamali De shared cryptic Instagram stories, adding fuel to the speculation.

TV actor Ashish Kapoor arrested on rape charges in PuneTelevision actor Ashish Kapoor was arrested on rape charges after a woman, who met him through Instagram, accused him of sexually assaulting her during a house party in Delhi.

Ranveer cheers as Deepika becomes 1st Indian jury member for Louis Vuitton PrizeActor Deepika Padukone became the first Indian jury member for Louis Vuitton Prize 2025. Her actor-husband Ranveer Singh posted an adorable comment on her recent post from the event.

Anupam Kher shares magical encounter with Shreya Ghoshal and MM KeeravaaniAnupam Kher shared a touching video of his "magical encounter" with Shreya Ghoshal and MM Keeravaani, where the duo's impromptu singing left fans mesmerised.

Sanjay Leela Bhansali to film Love & War climax in Sicily, ItalySanjay Leela Bhansali will shoot the climax of 'Love & War' in Sicily, Italy, featuring Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, and Vicky Kaushal. The film is scheduled for a release on March 20, 2026.

Samay Raina and Anurag Kashyap break the internet with new condom adComedian Samay Raina has made waves in Indian advertising with a bold condom-branded campaign featuring filmmaker Anurag Kashyap. The ad's unapologetic tone and witty banter have resonated with audiences.

Ahan Shetty on nepotism: Being Suniel's son brings both privilege and pressureAhan Shetty admitted that being Suniel Shetty's son gives him opportunities but also brings higher expectations and scrutiny.

Nishaanchi trailer: Anurag Kashyap unleashes mayhem with mafia, politics and rivalryThe trailer of director Anurag Kashyap's 'Nishaanchi' shows debutant Aaishvary Thackeray in a double-role. The film is set in the hinterlands of Uttar Pradesh from the early 2000s.

Real-life story of Inspector Zende, the man who nabbed Charles Sobhraj twiceNetflix's 'Inspector Zende' brings to life the story of Mumbai cop Madhukar Zende who captured serial killer Charles Sobhraj twice. Here's all you need to know about the former police officer.

Shah Rukh Khan prays for strength, stands with Punjab amid flood crisisShah Rukh Khan has come forward to support Punjab amid severe floods causing widespread devastation. Sharing a post on Instagram on Wednesday, the superstar prayed for strength.

My Life With Walter Boys 2 review: Love, loss and Cole's rise as the real heroRelease Date:Thu Aug 28, 2025Netflix's teen drama 'My Life With Walter Boys Season 2' takes Jackie's story forward with more heartbreak, complicated romances, and the ever-intense love triangle between Alex and Cole.

Disha Vakani, Taarak Mehta's Dayaben, makes rare public appearance at LalbaugchaDisha Vakani made a rare appearance at Mumbai's Lalbaugcha Raja during Ganesh Utsav, sparking fan excitement. Away from television since 2018, her return remains uncertain as the show's creator cites her family commitments.

28 Years Later The Bone Temple trailer: Humans fight against virus, zombiesDirector Nia DaCosta's '28 Years Later: The Bone Temple' has resumed the epic saga with new dangers. The post-apocalyptic film is the third instalment in the coming-of-age horror series.

general news.headline: Can't talk to India, China like that: Putin's 'colonial era' rebuke on US tariffsPutin also stressed that Washington's rhetoric echoes outdated thinking. "The colonial era is now over. They have to realise they can't use these terms in speaking with partners," he said.

Middle class emerges the king as GST 2.0 makes household items cheaperThe GST bonanza will leave more money in the hands of the middle class, which received a substantial tax relief earlier this year after annual income of up to Rs 12 lakh was made tax-free.
Trump's arms buy untruthsIndia has actually cut down arms buys from Russia and is buying more hardware from the US.

I told him...: Putin leaves world guessing over limo ride with PM Modi in ChinaVladimir Putin disclosed that he and Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke at length during their limousine ride at the SCO summit in China's Tianjin, but kept the conversation's details vague.

Relief camps flooded, flyover caves in as swollen Yamuna rages in Delhi-NCRSwollen Yamuna River in Delhi submerged relief camps, roads, and residential areas, collapsing infrastructure, disrupting essential services, and forcing mass evacuations.

Bihar polls or Trump tariffs? P Chidambaram questions timing of GST reformsThe GST Council, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, slashed slabs to 5 per cent and 18 per cent from September 22, making cars, bikes and household goods cheaper.

Like a Pomeranian: Karnataka BJP MLA likens woman IAS officer to dog, case filedBJP MLA BP Harish has been booked after Superintendent of Police Uma Prashanth filed a complaint over his "pet dog" remark, alleging bias towards the influential Congress leader's family.

Mahanaaryaman in MPCA hot seat: How Scindias have controlled Madhya Pradesh cricketMahanaaryaman Scindia is the third in the Scindia family to hold the MPCA president's post, after father Jyotiraditya Scindia and grandfather Madhavrao Scindia

US Open: Spotless Sinner puts friendship aside, decimates Musetti to reach semisJannik Sinner overpowered Lorenzo Musetti in the first all-Italian men's Grand Slam quarter-final at the US Open, extending his remarkable 26-match hardcourt winning streak to set up a semifinal clash with Félix Auger-Aliassime.

Get yourself a new job: Trump snaps at reporter, cites India sanctions on RussiaTrump's remarks came during a bilateral meeting in the Oval Office with Polish President Karol Nawrocki. Trump appeared visibly irked when a Polish reporter questioned him about showing frustration with Russian President Vladimir Putin but not taking action.

GST 2.0 cuts prices on TVs, cement, bikes; milk, paneer now tax-free. Check full listHouseholds stand to benefit the most, as a host of everyday items have seen major reductions. Hair oil, toilet soaps, shampoos, toothbrushes and bicycles will now attract just 5% GST, down from 18%.

UP man shoots estranged wife dead in busy market, leaves her bleeding; arrestedA man shot his wife dead near a photo studio in Gorakhpur after a heated argument, leaving her fatally wounded despite locals rushing her to the hospital. Police arrested the accused husband, who had a long-standing property dispute with his wife.
How China's new missile and drone arsenal raises global alarmBeijing has said its military might is meant for stability and peace, but the weapon systems can trigger concerns in  many world capitals.

'Longer you live...': Hot mic catches Putin, Xi musing on immortality, Kim looks onA hot microphone captured a rare unscripted exchange between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping — a conversation about organ transplants, longevity, and even the prospect of immortality.

Harvard wins court battle as judge reverses $2.6 billion Trump funding cutsA federal judge overturned Trump administration cuts to $2.6 billion in Harvard research funding, calling them illegal retaliation. The ruling revives stalled projects and intensifies stalled negotiations over a potential settlement.

Trump instructs Pentagon to prepare for deterring Russia, China amid rising tensionsWhile Beijing and Moscow have sought to project unity in the face of Western influence, Hegseth said, "Demonstrations and parades are good, but the United States hopes they will not manifest themselves in the form of a real military conflict."

India's Yuki Bhambri inches closer to his dream of winning Grand Slam crownIndia's Yuki Bhambri, a former singles specialist, continued his dream run in men's doubles at the US Open. The 33-year-old and his New Zealand partner Michael Venus defeated higher-ranked Rajeev Ram and Nikola Metkic to reach the doubles semi-final in New York on Wednesday, September 3.

Bastian is going nowhere: Shilpa Shetty clarifies, announces new plansActor Shilpa Shetty clarified that her popular Bandra restaurant, Bastian, is not closing. She also announced the launch of a new restaurant, Ammakai.

No GST on life and health insurance premiums from September 22After the 56th GST Council meeting, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that insurance services, which currently attract 18% GST, will now be fully exempt.

From the India Today archives (1989) | Long before PM Modi, how Rajiv Gandhi breached the China wallPost-1962 war, for the 26 years leading to Rajiv Gandhi's visit, relations between India and China had been in deep freeze—activated only by border hostilities

The Voice of Hind Rajab, drama on Gaza girl, gets 23-min ovation at Venice Fest'The Voice of Hind Rajab' docu-drama premiered at the Venice Film Festival to a 23-minute standing ovation. The film sheds light on the tragic death of a six-year-old Gaza girl amid Israeli military fire, sparking calls for justice and awareness.

GST 2.0: Check the complete list of goods under 40% sin taxThe new system, called GST 2.0, introduces a simpler two-slab structure and makes several changes to the way goods are taxed. These changes will take effect from 22 September 2025.
Bengaluru couple spends Rs 5.9 lakh monthly, shares expense list in viral videoIn a now-viral video, a Bengaluru-based couple broke down their expenses for the month of August in detail.

80% genius, 20% problems: Trump praises Musk, expects him back in Republican PartyThe Trump-Musk relationship, once partners, deteriorated in May after Musk became a vocal critic of Trump's One Big Beautiful Bill. Musk alleged that the bill, which Trump championed, would worsen the federal deficit by trillions of dollars.

sports.headline: US Open: Spotless Sinner puts friendship aside, decimates Musetti to reach semisJannik Sinner overpowered Lorenzo Musetti in the first all-Italian men's Grand Slam quarter-final at the US Open, extending his remarkable 26-match hardcourt winning streak to set up a semifinal clash with Félix Auger-Aliassime.

India's Yuki Bhambri inches closer to his dream of winning Grand Slam crownIndia's Yuki Bhambri, a former singles specialist, continued his dream run in men's doubles at the US Open. The 33-year-old and his New Zealand partner Michael Venus defeated higher-ranked Rajeev Ram and Nikola Metkic to reach the doubles semi-final in New York on Wednesday, September 3.

CAFA Nations Cup: India chase redemption vs Afghanistan with final spot on the lineIndia face Afghanistan on September 4 in a must-win CAFA Nations Cup clash in Tajikistan. Eighteen months after their shock Guwahati defeat, the Blue Tigers aim for redemption, a place in the final, and renewed confidence.

Super 4s wake-up call: India's old flaws resurface, new ones emerge after drawSome old issues resurfaced and new ones emerged during India's frustrating 2-2 draw against Korea in the Super 4s opener in the Asia Cup 2025 in Rajgir. With forwards still failing to click and not creating enough PCs, the hosts will have their work cut out in the next two games.

Naomi Osaka continues dream run to reach semis, Anisimova stuns SwiatekNaomi Osaka defeated Karolína Muchová to reach the semi-finals, where she will be joined by Amanda Anisimova, who delivered one of the tournament's biggest shocks by ousting second seed Iga Swiatek.

Watch: Iga Swiatek snaps at reporter's mental break question after US Open lossIga Swiatek's post-match press conference took an awkward turn after her US Open quarterfinal defeat to Amanda Anisimova on Wednesday, as she snapped at a reporter's question about whether she needed a mental break.

US Open: Four years felt like a lifetime, Canada's Felix back in Grand Slam semisFelix Auger-Aliassime has reached the US Open semifinals after a thrilling comeback against Alex de Minaur. His win boosts hopes for a strong finish at the ATP Finals and marks a significant return to form.

Suruchi Inder Singh tops ISSF 10m air pistol rankings, Manu Bhaker slips to sixthIndian teen shooter Suruchi Inder Singh climbed to world No.1 in the ISSF women's 10m air pistol rankings, overtaking Chinese rivals after a stellar season. Double Olympic medallist Manu Bhaker, meanwhile, secured the sixth spot.

Julien Nagelsmann sets bold target as Germany eye 2026 World Cup gloryJulien Nagelsmann set out his target with the German national team eyeing their fifth World Cup title in 2026 as they prepare for their qualifying campaign against Slovakia

Bayer Levekusen eye Ange Postecoglou as next manager after Erik ten Hag disasterAnge Postecoglou is back in the spotlight as Bayer Leverkusen and Fenerbahce, fresh off sacking ex-Manchester United bosses Erik ten Hag and Jose Mourinho, consider the former Tottenham Hotspur manager for their high-stakes rebuilding projects in Europe.

Asia Cup: South Korea halts India's momentum with 2-2 draw in rain-hit Super 4s openerHockey Asia Cup: India's winning momentum at the Asia Cup 2025 came to an end as Korea held them to a 2-2 draw in Rajgir. Hardik and Mandeep Singh's goals helped India gain a valuable point in the end.

US Open: Four years felt like a lifetime, Canada's Felix back in Grand Slam semisFelix Auger-Aliassime has reached the US Open semifinals after a thrilling comeback against Alex de Minaur. His win boosts hopes for a strong finish at the ATP Finals and marks a significant return to form.

Suruchi Inder Singh tops ISSF 10m air pistol rankings, Manu Bhaker slips to sixthIndian teen shooter Suruchi Inder Singh climbed to world No.1 in the ISSF women's 10m air pistol rankings, overtaking Chinese rivals after a stellar season. Double Olympic medallist Manu Bhaker, meanwhile, secured the sixth spot.

Julien Nagelsmann sets bold target as Germany eye 2026 World Cup gloryJulien Nagelsmann set out his target with the German national team eyeing their fifth World Cup title in 2026 as they prepare for their qualifying campaign against Slovakia

Asia Cup: South Korea halts India's momentum with 2-2 draw in rain-hit Super 4s openerHockey Asia Cup: India's winning momentum at the Asia Cup 2025 came to an end as Korea held them to a 2-2 draw in Rajgir. Hardik and Mandeep Singh's goals helped India gain a valuable point in the end.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
